instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
threads.message:
i got this machine after customer tried doing their own battery replacement. the isl had a hole through it and q7030 was shorted to ground along with q7055. replaced both and machine turns on but is too slow after it gets into OS also the mac runs on battery but wont see it or turn on without adapter plugged in. macbook will run without a hitch in recovery mode. when checking disc with first aid i get invalid flag warnings. ran system with external drive and still runs slow. i ran apple hardware diagnostics test and it came back with no errors. i included hardware monitor values if it may help.

also cpuvcore is 0.865v as opposed to the 1.25v on schematic if that matters.

threads.title: 820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
threads.message: replaced smc and still issue persists

threads.title: 820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
threads.message: Battery recognized now? Without battery recognized it will run slow...dead battery?

threads.title: 820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
threads.message: Battery still not recognized. I will admit while hooking battery back up the isl blew again and had to replace it so not sure if i fucked the new smc up or if the issue lies elsewhere.

threads.title: 820-3462 system load high (kernel task) and wont detect battery
threads.message: Throw away that battery as it is killing the SMC and ISL. Replace battery, ISL and SMC again....
